name: Remark
description: Observation that isnâ€™t formally defined like a theorem, lemma, proposition etc. but is something to which you wish to draw attention and to which you may wish to be able to refer.

name: Conjecture
description: A conjecture is a conclusion or a proposition which is suspected to be true due to preliminary supporting evidence, but for which no proof or disproof has yet been found

name: Corollary
description: A corollary is a theorem that follows very easily from another theorem. For this reason, corollaries frequently do not have proofs. You are expected to easily and quickly see how a previous theorem implies the corollary.
